intro: Koellia albescens, commonly known as the white-flowered koellia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Koellia albescens is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its botanical structure reflects its evolutionary adaptations to survive in harsh, dry conditions.
